summary: The Providing Child Care for Police Officers Act of 2025 establishes a grant pilot program to provide child care services for the children of law enforcement officers. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will award grants to lead agencies to support child care programs, addressing the shift work and nontraditional hours of officers. Grants are for a 3-year period and include a set-aside for smaller law enforcement agencies. The bill sets matching requirements and includes stipulations around audits, misuse of funds, and required studies. It authorizes appropriations of $24 million annually from 2026-2030, with a termination date of September 30, 2030.
